entry.title: 'Test With Title 13'
entry.content:
#!/usr/bin/python3

import subprocess
import sys
import os
import time

titlestring = sys.argv[1]
rake_arg = "new_post['{}']".format(titlestring)
p = subprocess.Popen(["rake", rake_arg], stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
out, err = p.communicate()
time.sleep(2)
out = out.decode().strip()
out = out.replace("Creating new post: ", "", 1)
cwd = os.getcwd()
postfile = os.path.join(cwd, out)
print(postfile)

if not err:
    subprocess.call(["gvim", postfile])
else:
    print(err)
    exit(1)

entry.title: Test With Title 9
entry.content:
finally we get a post directly from gvim!

#!/usr/bin/python3

import subprocess
import sys
import os

titlestring = sys.argv[1]
rake_arg = "new_post['{}']".format(titlestring)
p = subprocess.Popen(["rake", rake_arg], stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
out, err = p.communicate()
out = out.decode()
out = out.replace("Creating new post: ", "", 1)
cwd = os.getcwd()
postfile = os.path.join(cwd, out)

if not err:
    subprocess.call(["gvim", postfile])
else:
    print(err)
    exit(1)
